com.ftdichip.ftd2xx

Class EEPROM

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.EEPROM

  • public class EEPROM
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides access to a FTD2xx device`s EEPROM.
    Author:
    Mike Werner

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void erase()
      Erases the entire contents of an EEPROM, including the user area.
      int getUserAreaSize()
      Retrieves the size of the User Area within the EEPROM.
      DeviceDescriptor readDeviceDescriptor()
      Reads the device descriptor from the devices EEPROM.
      int readUserArea(byte[] data)
      Reads the contents of the User Area.
      void writeDeviceDescriptor(DeviceDescriptor desc)
      Writes the device descriptor of the device that is the owner of this EEPROM.
      void writeUserArea(byte[] data)
      Writes the new data to the User Area.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • readDeviceDescriptor

        public DeviceDescriptor readDeviceDescriptor()
                                      throws FTD2xxException
        Reads the device descriptor from the devices EEPROM.
        Returns:
        the device descriptor of the device that owns this EEPROM. According to the device a DeviceDescriptorobject is returned or one of it`s sub-classes.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the device descriptor can not be read.

      • writeDeviceDescriptor

        public void writeDeviceDescriptor(DeviceDescriptor desc)
                           throws FTD2xxException
        Writes the device descriptor of the device that is the owner of this EEPROM.
        Parameters:
        desc - the device descriptor to be written.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the device descriptor can not be read.

      • getUserAreaSize

        public int getUserAreaSize()
                    throws FTD2xxException
        Retrieves the size of the User Area within the EEPROM.
        Returns:
        the size of the User Area in bytes.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the size can not be read.

      • readUserArea

        public int readUserArea(byte[] data)
                 throws FTD2xxException
        Reads the contents of the User Area.
        Parameters:
        data - the buffer to store the data in.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the data can not be read.

      • writeUserArea

        public void writeUserArea(byte[] data)
                   throws FTD2xxException
        Writes the new data to the User Area.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be written.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the data can not be written.

      • erase

        public void erase()
           throws FTD2xxException
        Erases the entire contents of an EEPROM, including the user area.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the EEPROM can not be erased.
